bill_title: provide for the disbursement of catastrophic county poor relief fund to the participating counties in the event of the discontinuance of the fund.

bill_versions.bill_text: An Act to provide for the disbursement of catastrophic county poor relief fund to the participating counties in the event of the discontinuance of the fund. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That § 28-13A-5 be AMENDED: 28-13A-5. If at the end of any calendar year less fewer than thirty‑five counties elect to remain in the catastrophic county poor relief fund at the end of any calendar year, a final assessment shall be made to reestablish the reserve, the fund shall be must be discontinued and the reserve shall revert to the state general fund reverted to the counties participating in the fund at the time the fund is discontinued in proportion to the amount of money that each county contributed pursuant to § 28-13A-9. If the fund balance is negative when the fund is discontinued, a final assessment must be made on and paid in full by all counties participating in the fund at the time the fund is discontinued in proportion to the amount of money each county received, pursuant to this chapter, to bring the fund balance to zero.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
